Articles.Content:
Hello!

So today, I decided to send a Spacestation to duna, I launched the kethane lander with big docking port in front and on sides the small ones, after I did the orbit, circularized and 1600 of fuel left in my jumbo tank ( for the mainsail ). I decided to send the spacestation to orbit, then dock with the lander, so when I reach duna I can land and still have some fuel in my station, that way I hit 2 birds with one rock.

But that's not the problem.. the problem is I don't have enough fuel to carry that weight to duna, So i must launch a refueler to dock with the lander and refuel the Jumbo tank, I launched , and when docking my spacecraft ( refueler ) was shaking so bad! even with RCS and ASAS, I tried everything I could to dock, but a success.. I docked, then in all of a sudden the refueler shaked HARD and wipped the tank that would refuel the Jumbo tank. what caused this ?

EDIT: Answered! thanks for the answer Dynamo!

Edited August 2, 2013 by MrPopcup

While the description here seems kind of vague to me, i think that you're getting the post docking wobbles here. If you noticed that the SAS and/or RCS were still engaged after docking, that may have been what caused your issue. Your SAS and RCS gets confused when you dock larger ships together, as the "impact" of docking can throw off your ship, causing the RCS to go into a frenzy to get back to the heading you wanted it to stay at. The violent shaking that follows can tear apart more fragile ships. When docking these ships then, it is advisable to turn off BOTH SAS and RCS as soon as you dock, and cancel the gyration with time warp. If you could provide pictures, that would help a great deal.

While the description here seems kind of vague to me, i think that you're getting the post docking wobbles here. If you noticed that the SAS and/or RCS were still engaged after docking, that may have been what caused your issue. Your SAS and RCS gets confused when you dock larger ships together, as the "impact" of docking can throw off your ship, causing the RCS to go into a frenzy to get back to the heading you wanted it to stay at. The violent shaking that follows can tear apart more fragile ships. When docking these ships then, it is advisable to turn off BOTH SAS and RCS as soon as you dock, and cancel the gyration with time warp. If you could provide pictures, that would help a great deal.

Thanks man! Successfully docked those 2 things together, Phew..! It was really hard to dock them.. I used your advise ( Turn off ASAS and RCS ) and it worked like charm! now I have a spacestation around duna and a kethane miner! yay!!

P.S: Excuse me, english is my 3rd language and I was in a hurry when I wrote that.. you can count in that i'm also very fast in typing..
